newsitem.title: USA: MERISEL IN TALKS TO IMPROVE DEBT PROPOSAL.
newsitem.headline: MERISEL IN TALKS TO IMPROVE DEBT PROPOSAL.

text.p: Merisel Inc said Tuesday it is in active discussions with holders of its 12.5 percent senior notes about improving its debt restructuring proposal.
The company said no additional details of these discussions could be released at this time.
Merisel also said it received a new proposal from Stonington Partners Inc, an investment company, amending the investment firm's original equity proposal.
Stonington would loan $152 million to the company in the form of a convertible debt instrument to refinance existing operating debt.

This would be convertible into 10,482,800 shares of common stock at $14.50 per share after giving effect to a one-for-five reverse stock split, representing 63.5 percent of the company's outstanding common stock.
Stonington's original proposal would have provided $152 million in exchange for 70 percent of the outstanding common stock.
Stonington's amended proposal also permits Merisel to offer certain incentives to the noteholders, including provisions to pay up to $250 per $1,000 face amount of 12.5 percent notes outstanding.
